poem:
Title: "The Fabric of Industry"

Unravelled yarn of workaday,
Spindles spare from yesterday's loom,
Purse strings tighten, wages higher climb, 
Economic seesaw in the lunchtime room. 

Shadows idle in the factories,
Retail temples echo less laughter,
Ale houses mourn the absent cheer,
Threadbare dreams, what are we after?

Witness the paradox of plenty's price,
Oh, who can cut this Gordian dice?
